Space: Solar panels require a certain amount of space to be installed on the roof. If a home does not have enough space, it may not be possible to install solar panels.
Maintenance: Solar panels require regular maintenance to ensure they are functioning properly. This can be time-consuming and may require specialized knowledge.
Weather: Solar panels rely on sunlight to generate electricity. If the weather is cloudy or overcast, the solar panels may not generate as much electricity as expected.

Inverter: An inverter is required to convert the DC electricity generated by the solar panels into AC electricity that can be used in the home. If the inverter fails, the solar panels will not function.
Grid connection: Solar panels can be connected to the grid, allowing homeowners to sell excess electricity back to the grid. However, this may require additional equipment and paperwork.
